Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2013 09:44AM julieped wrote: Lemonless, I was diagnosed on August 28th and had a bilateral mastectomy and reconstruction on September 11th.  I am six weeks out and doing pretty well.  I believe the hardest part is waiting and not knowing.  You wait for appointments, test results, etc.  I will be thinking of you. Remember that each diagnosis and person is different.  Listen to your doctors and while there is a lot of good information on this website, some posters may give you wrong information for your situation.  (see above)
Posts.Title: impatient and wondering how long from diagnosis to surgery? lemonless princessblu

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2013 09:13AM julieped wrote: One more thing, I am SO sick of pink too!
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 21, 2013 08:23AM julieped wrote: MBLizzzy - I saw your note on the champion bra at Target.  I had a bilateral mastectomy also but am only wearing a loose camisole from the Loft.  Does the compression of the champion bra feel good with your TE?  Just wanted to get an opinion.  Thanks.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 25, 2013 02:43PM julieped wrote: algranna, I will be thinking of you the day of your surgery.  The first 3 weeks  I did a lot of sleeping and took the pain pills regularlly.  I missed taking a shower for the first week or so but my husband would wash my hair everyday.  Mke sure to do the arm exercises that are recommended they have really help me.  I started the fills for my TE's at week four.  They do not hurt at all.  It is really quick and I have had no problem with them.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 8, 2013 09:12AM julieped wrote: Sandy, I am waiting for my oncotype test. The waiting is hard but I should get mine next week. I hope that I get a low score like you did. But once you get that score there are so many decisions to make. I'll think of you as you make that decision and will let you know when I get my score and what i decide.
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Sep 30, 2013 04:10PM julieped wrote: CJC - Your sugery will go well.  It is so hard to wait, you can't really think about anything else. My surgery went well and I was in the hospital for two nights.  The drains were in for two weeks and other than being annoying they did not bother me too much.  I was a bit surprised by the pain after the surgery but the drugs really help.  Please let me know how your surgery goes.  Julie
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 3, 2013 02:57PM julieped wrote: Thoughts and prayers for all.  This is a tough time in our lives.  i try to have faith that things will improve.  I am three weeks post surgery, BMX, TE.  I am still taking pain meds, but not as much as the beginning.  Still a lot of pain.  Anyone else still on pain meds after three weeks?
Posts.Title: September 2013 surgery hobbesla4 Katlebbie

Posts.Content: Oct 17, 2013 02:20PM julieped wrote: Beatrice, I am five weeks out and I am feeling so much better.  Around week 3 or4 I turned a corner.  I still take a muscle relaxant and that helps a lot.  By evening I am unconfortable just because I am tired.  It will get better.  Get lots of rest and take good care of yourself.
